tweets.text:
@KGB_GB @jimjamjamesy @jones160187 @herefordtimes @Warzoid @JohnWilsonNQ Seems he was planning to do 'a bit of work' in this very area but wasn't allowed.
https://t.co/yHTVQIn7NI

1/2: IF it is correct that this destruction was permitted by @EnvAgency, then they should only have permitted it having sought the assent of @NaturalEngland (because it's a #SSSI) & it will also have required an assessment under the Habitats Regulations (because it's also an SAC) https://t.co/QdW8F8p2Js

@SteveCJjones @EnvAgency I'm working off NE SSSI database. It says River Lugg SSSI overlaps with River Wye SAC so can't be sure re section affected - although works on any part of the river would affect areas downstream so assessment would have been required even if not inside SAC https://t.co/VQAmT7tsyB

@Biginabox @jcreedy @RobGMacfarlane @EnvAgency Would be quite a stupid thing to do if they did. Illegally clear and alter river bank (that obviously has a high flood risk) and then apply for planning permission to build on it (or just start building on it if that's their style!)
This needs sharing far and wide in light of the abuse @EnvAgency @HerefordshireWT etc are getting in certain newspapers! https://t.co/UgZSwfdK7t
@EnvAgency @KendalSave I think more than 500 trees in the middle of Kendal are going to be felled by the @EnvAgency for flood defences?
@EkudYkcin @EnvAgencyYNE @CityofYork @yorkshireforum @EnvAgency @YorkshireMuseum I can see how the barrier blocks the gate. Unclear how the hedge stops water.

Appalling #EcoVandalism at The #RiverLugg SSSI #Herefordshire

That‚Äôs great @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK but what about all of the trees and woodland area that will be destroyed in North Ferriby to make way for a 558,000sqft #Amazon warehouse placed directly next to homes https://t.co/Qww01kAH4L
@bentheoandrews @SeanWilko4 @alex_green84 @BalfourBok @EnvAgency It could well be. In which case I withdraw my comment. I had presumed too much.
@dahontr3 @EnvAgencyYNE @CityofYork @yorkshireforum @EnvAgency @YorkshireMuseum What about it?

We‚Äôve used our powers of entry at the River Lugg #Herefordshire incident

14 specialist officers from @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil now on site gathering information & evidence. https://t.co/LLCOFQHCox
@SeanWilko4 @DanielMacKenzi6 @alex_green84 @BalfourBok @EnvAgency This just looks like standard coppicing of riverbank trees.

tweets.text:
We've successfully tested the new demountable defences at the Memorial Gardens installed as part of #YorkFAS to help reduce the risk of flooding & make sure we are prepared for winter.

Over ¬£45m has been invested in better protection for 2,000 local homes & business in #York https://t.co/GH35tUc5fO
@EnvAgency policy on river management, water abstraction & waste treatment? https://t.co/b0VcOnDsxL
Or maybe this? https://t.co/bcALsiebLg
@EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm Can you confirm exactly when the @EnvAgency were informed about this incident?

Perhaps most interesting about the devastation on the River Lugg is that the landowner purported to be responsible had recently had an application for 19 homes on his land refused. One of the key points for refusal was the site‚Äôs proximity to the River...üò° https://t.co/4uiVVMGH3C https://t.co/jYrltg1dA8

#Flooding affects millions worldwide and we need more engineers. 

Join us, @EnvAgency and @learnliveuk on Friday 11 Dec 10am BST to hear what it‚Äôs like to study a sponsored degree in Flood and Coastal Engineering and ask questions.  

Register here: https://t.co/UX0iukfGVl https://t.co/xvfBtzGXxo
@RoeliendenOuden @jamiemorganuk @BSnowhand @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm Yes, been tweeting about it.
@jamiemorganuk @BSnowhand @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @JeffOllerton , have you seen this?

@timthefruit @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @defra Can the huge reduction in monitoring of the health of such an important site (among many unmonitored SSSI's) really just be due to the steady defunding by our govt of @NaturalEngland I wonder?

@BSnowhand @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm Seems the local parish council and EA knew this in advance before the destruction. As I've said before hanging the landowner theres an investigation to be done

https://t.co/3iNAScRPi6

Seven years ago over 800 properties in Boston were flooded by a tidal surge.
Fast forward to today the barrier project is now 65% complete with a barrier that can be used in a tidal surge event !
#PrepareActSurvive #BostonBarrier @EnvAgency https://t.co/iiOWzsVhVM

tweets.text:
A mile of the River Lugg has been bulldozed to destruction.
Bankside trees grubbed out & burnt.
Riverbed scraped out.
Meanders reprofiled.
Disaster for downstream wildlife.
This was an SSSI.
No consent was sought. 
@EnvAgency must surely prosecute this.
RT
https://t.co/cSBhrR2nDW

Curiouser and curiouser.

Farmer claims that he was given permission to dredge the riverbed and reprofile the bank by the @EnvAgency "I have been allowed to do by the Environment Agency", he says. (1/2)

https://t.co/cxiwV3YF4M

We're mounting a wide-ranging investigation into reports of damage to the #RiverLugg, which is protected through SSSI status. We're treating this very seriously, working with @NaturalEngland & @ForestryComm who have taken immediate action to prevent any further works at the site. https://t.co/bvhnTETfal

Residents try to protect their river, by moving a chicken farm proposal off a FLOODPLAIN

...& then @EnvAgency:

'said it was up to local councils to decide where new developments such as poultry units should be set.'

...& here is the problem.

 https://t.co/cvGSZlXaZS

urls.title: Cumbria | The Flood Hub
urls.description: This local spaces area will provide information o n our aim to manage flood risk on a catchment scale from Source to Sea. In this section we will introduce you to Cumbria Strategic Flood Partnership, a collective of organisations that coordinates all flood risk management planning and delivery and detailed information on Flood Risk Management Schemes being delivered.

tweets.text:
In 2015 Storm Desmond hit Cumbria flooding many areas including the town of #Egremont. 
 
5 years on and #TeamEA are investing 12 million on a flood scheme for the town with works ongoing to better protect 220 properties from flooding. 
 
For more info - https://t.co/UibqT7Itw6 https://t.co/kDcqp2sM3E

@RareBreedChris @Cat_Early76 @stuartpengs @RachSalv @CraigBennett3 @HelenStace_HWT @WildlifeTrusts @HerefordshireWT @CIWEM @EnvAgency I think Somerset 2014 has got a lot to answer for. The way govt caved and dredged made people all over think dredging is the answer. Set river management back years.
@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Feargal it's a bloody mess! What damage has been done to the riverbed and all the wee critters that lived in it? Reprofile the bank? Into what???

Trees are vital in protecting our rivers.  

That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre putting ¬£1.4 million towards funding 15 community projects to plant more trees near rivers and streams.  

Read: https://t.co/Gf0f3pgLNY  
 
#PlantMoreTrees #NationalTreeWeek #TogetherForOurPlanet https://t.co/9ILpU5ivbX
